tweets.text: I am presenting at my first (big!) conference in my PhD #ICA21 #ICA_JSD. If you are interested in Immersive Journalis, go check out: "Feeling the news? - The Differential Effects of IJ on Emotional Response‚Äú.  We did four experiments to see, what about IJ is emotion inducing.1/4 https://t.co/5dHikxwcC8

This means, when designing and evaluating IJ the different features of IJ - apart from the level of inclusion - need to be taken into account. 

And: Storytelling is key! #ICA21 #ICA_JSD 4/4 https://t.co/JHtxEytegL

Check out our panel (recording) of "Practice-based methodologies in #digital #journalismstudies " during #ica21. With @laahva Tamara Witschge @nikkiusher @dryfe @mluenenborg @wolre @MiriamSiemon #ICA_JSD.

And lastly, two very different perspectives on precarity. First, in @KarinWahlJ's study, journalists and founders in local journalism start-ups justify the sacrifices they have to make with narrations of passion. #ICA21 #ica_jsd https://t.co/lMsMMpllcl

Day two of #ica21 and I want to continue with some recommendations, this time from #ica_jsd. First, check out this work in progress by @bissieanderson on relationality in pioneer journalism! https://t.co/sc6wVbJyiM

Field theory is often criticised for not taking technology into account. @Terje_Lindblom, Johan Lindell and Katarina Gidlund offer an intriguing approach to explain institutional technology-related change. #ICA21 #ica_jsd https://t.co/eR7mQ7YGvM

https://t.co/NTXQIOZkb5 @icahdq #ica21 @fg_moeg @CSW_AEJMC @ICAGLBT @ICAPopular
